alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Central Interior Cumberland; Coastal Cumberland; Kennebec; Lincoln; Sagadahoc (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 4:32PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Kennebec, southeastern Androscoggin, west central Lincoln, east central Cumberland and Sagadahoc Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 432 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Litchfield to near Auburn. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lewiston, Auburn, Brunswick, Bath, Gardiner, Topsham, Wiscasset, Litchfield, Woolwich, Lisbon, Durham, Bowdoin, Bowdoinham, Dresden, Alna, Sabattus, Richmond, West Bath, Wales and Pittston. This includes the following highways... Interstate 295 between mile markers 28 and 48. Interstate 95 between mile markers 81 and 98. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for south central and southwestern Maine.
